title: Feature Request: Move window with keyboard shortcuts
author: bveldkamp
body_snippet:
When I want to move a window to a different monitor, I usually do this with the [Win]+[Shift]+[arrow] keyboard shortcut. This does however not work with mRemoteNG.

Using the mouse to move a maximized window causes the mRemoteNG window to resize, which in turn causes any RDP session to reconnect, which takes some time. Using this keyboard shortcut keeps a window maximized.

I realize that some keyboard shortcuts should be redirected to the RDP connection, but moving a window to a different s...

iterations.description: mRemoteNG hosts remote protocol sessions (RDP, VNC, SSH) that consume keyboard input directly, making global keyboard window-move shortcuts impractical and likely to conflict with remote session keybindings; window management is delegated to the OS (Alt+Space, Win+arrows).

notes:
AI triage (claude): mRemoteNG hosts remote protocol sessions (RDP, VNC, SSH) that consume keyboard input directly, making global keyboard window-move shortcuts impractical and likely to conflict with remote session keybindings; window management is delegated to the OS (Alt+Space, Win+arrows).
Approach: Decline — keyboard shortcuts for moving the host application window would conflict with remote session input capture; users should use OS-native shortcuts (Alt+Space → Move, Win+arrows)
